diary.description:
YAHOO.widget.Diary produces a weekly diary showing events, and allows them to
be editted.
diary.title: Diary widget
diary.requires: yahoo, event, event-delegate, event-mouseenter, dom, datasource, selector, dragdrop, resize, datemath, calendar
diary.name: diary

YAHOO.widget.Diary.name: YAHOO.widget.Diary

useCssCategories.description:
If true, any CATEGORIES will be added as css classes
to the container element for the DiaryItem, allowing styling and filtering.
Anything passed to backClass will also be added.  Spaces in categories
will be changed to hyphens.

startDate.description:
When to start the diary display from.  Will change this
to the correct day if keepFirstDay is set.

endDate.description: Final date currently displayed on Diary

allowCreateMultiDayItems.description: Whether, when creating new items, they're allowed to span multi days

locale.description: Which locale to use when parsing dates. See YAHOO.util.Date and YAHOO.util.DateLocale. For more info.

pxPerHour.description: Number of pixels per hour.   Write once.

itemClickCreateNew.description:
Whether you can click and drag on an existing item 
to start creating a new one.

fieldMap.default:
{ UID: "UID",
           DTSTART: "DTSTART",
           DTEND:   "DTEND",
           SUMMARY: "SUMMARY",
           DESCRIPTION: "DESCRIPTION",
           CATEGORIES: "CATEGORIES",
           LOCATION: "LOCATION",
           URL: "URL",
           backClass: "backClass",
           detailClass: "detailClass" }
fieldMap.description:
Field map, mapping keys of DataSource to expected keys of data for DiaryItems. DiaryItem keys are the keys in the object passed; values are the names of the fields in the DataSource. backClass is the css class string applied to the background container of the DiaryItem; detailClass is the css class string applied to the element holding the text of the item. These can be used by addItemFilter to show or hide items by category.

DTSTART and DTEND need to be strings; but other values may be functions. These functions are called on the Diary instance (i.e. this in your function is the Diary, and receive the raw data literal as their only argument. They must return the actual value, not a field name.

Write once

width.type: Number (Optional) Will use element styled width if no value provided and it has one

keepFirstDay.description:
Whether the first column should be restricted to 
a particular day of the week.  If so, pass the day of the week
(with 0 = Sunday).

tooltip.description:
Whether to use tooltip for mouseover events to show details.
Write once.

titleString.description:
String to use as template for title.  You can use 
strftime type identifiers.  Write once.

animate.description:
Whether to use animation when moving items around.
Write once.

calenderNav.description:
Whether to use a YAHOO.widget.Calendar in the navigation.
Write once.

display.description:
Display formats: object literal with format and start and end times (in 24-hour clock hours) displayed in the main window (the rest are above and below the scroll. 
{ format: "week", startTime: 8, endTime: 20 }
. Formats available are "day", "week", and "month".

scaleColumns.description: Whether to scale columns to width.  writeOnce

params.name: el
params.description: Container element for the Diary

params.name: oDS
params.description:
DataSource instance.  Each 'row' in the
data will need a start date/time and end date/time, both as js Date objects.
Use the fieldMap config attribute to map data fields to those expected
by Diary - DTSTART and DTEND.

params.name: oCfg
params.description: Object literal of config values.

constructors.description:
The main diary;

This is the main object. It:

  1. gets the data
  2. does the main background display
  3. sets up the DiaryDay objects and calls their render methods
  4. holds delegated event listeners for the DiaryItems

_reFormat.description:
Called on formatChange to alter start/end time window
or day/week/month to view.

return.description: The string representation of the Diary

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the object.

render.description:
Renders the Diary.  Called after data is parsed - shouldn't
need to be called otherwise.

params.name: titleString
params.description: Title string with strftime placeholders.

renderTitle.description:
Overwriteable to render title string
Can use strftime identifiers in the format string

_handleColumnHeaderClick.description:
Handles column header clicks.  Does different things 
depending on view: on week view, goes to day-to-view; on day view
goes back to week view; on month view does nothing.

handleItemMouseEnter.description:
When a DiaryItem is mouseenter-ed.  Default behaviour
is to show a tooltip (if this was enabled in the config).  The
itemMouseEnter event is fired first; return false to this to stop 
the default behaviour.

_getDay.description: Returns a Date object with times set to 0

_renderTitle.description:
Puts the title text in the title container box
Doesn't actually produce the title string though.

return.description: Date or first if it doesn't fall in range.

_findFirstItemDay.description:
Looks for the first day between startDate and endDate that has a column
in the diary; multi-day items may not start in range but may go into it.

unlock.description:
Unlocks resize and/or drag-drop for all currently existing
DiaryItems.

params.name: selDate
params.description:
Selected date, as returned by YAHOO.util.Calendar
(ie array [[[ yyyy, mm, dd]]])

_doCalNav.description: Go to any start date (set by calendar)

_renderColumnLabels.description: Adds column headers and date labels, and click listeners

params.name: req
params.description: Request object

params.name: data
params.description: Data returned by DataSource

_parseData.description: Parses the data when it comes

_endSelector.description: Called at the end of selector - creating a new item by drag-drop

params.name: ev
params.description:
Event object; used to position.  Pass an object
with ev.clientX and ev.clientY to position the Calendar manually.

params.name: req
params.description: Request object that failed

_dataFailed.description: Called if sendRequest fails on the data

_applyFilters.description:
Re-applies all filters currently in place.
Called internally when navigating to keep existing filters in place

_applyFiltersToElement.description:
Re-applies all filters to the element passed.
Called internally when navigating to keep existing filters in place.

_renderTooltip.description: Renders tooltip for showing full info

lock.description:
Locks resize and/or drag-drop for all currently existing
DiaryItems.

return.description: True if oItem2 is before oItem1

_itemSorter.description: Sorting function for arranging items in ascending date/time order

_renderCoreDiary.description: Renders the Diary except for the items.

addItemFilter.description:
Filters DiaryItems based on css selector.
selector passed will be appended directly to ".lplt-diary-item"
If nothing is passed, it will filter for all (ie hide everything)

_doFirstDayOfTodaysWeek.description: Goes to the start of this week

initListeners.description: Set up delegated event listeners for rendering and mouse events

_parseDataUsingFieldMap.description:
Uses fieldMap given in config to extract from raw data
to format expected by DiaryItems.  Values in the fieldMap may be strings
or functions, so this applies them as appropriate.

params.name: oData
params.description: Object literal containing raw data to be parsed

params.name: secsDate
params.description: start time in seconds.

getDiaryDay.description: Get the DiaryDay object based on date (in seconds)

renderItems.description: Renders the diary Items onto the Diary

params.name: oDate
params.description: Date object

renderDateLabel.description:
Overwritable to render date labels at the top of each column.
Default is oDate.toString().substring(0, 10);

_destroyDays.description: Destroys the days rendered in the diary

params.name: oCfg
params.description: Data for the new item, minimally- DTSTART: oDate, DTEND: oDate

params.name: redraw
params.description: Whether to redraw once it's added

addItem.description: Add an item to the Diary

_startNewItem.description: Click and drag to add new DiaryItem

initData.description: Store a reference to the data and get it

_sameDay.description: Are date1 and date2 the same day?

_setDiaryPosition.description:
Sets the height of the visible pane and scrollTop to 
show the correct segment of the Diary (e.g. 8am to 7pm)

getItem.description: Returns the DiaryItem with id elId

params.name: item
params.description: DiaryItem to remove

removeItem.description: Removes an item from the diary and destroys the element

return.description: True if oItem2 is before oItem1

_rawItemSorter.description: Sorting function for arranging items in ascending date/time order, using raw data objects

params.name: oItem1
params.description: Property DTSTART used for sorting

params.name: oItem2
params.description: Property DTSTART of comparison item for sort

removeItemFilter.description:
Removes filter on DiaryItems based on css selector.
selector passed will be appended directly to ".lplt-diary-item"
If nothing is passed, it will filter for all (ie show everything)

_renderNav.description:
Renders the navigation. 
Provides left, today, calendar and right buttons, and adds listeners.

_reDo.description:
Redraws calendar.  If getData is true, it will delete
DiaryItems and data currently held first

_getData.description: Gets data from the data source

getNavContainer.description: Returns the container for the navigation els

_renderLoading.todo: Sort out - messes with navigation currently...
_renderLoading.description:
Will adds a div with a 'loading' class to indicate data's on 
it's way.  Doesn't do anything at the moment.

return.description:
Number of items shown/hidden: positive => shown; negative 
value => hidden

_resizeSelectorDiv.description: Resizes the selector when creating a new item

_getEndOfDay.description: Returns a Date object with times set to 23:59:59

params.name: format
params.description: type of view

setupDays.description: Display days of the week holders

_tooltip.description: Re-usable tooltip, if included on page

_lockResize.description: Whether resizing of DiaryItems is allowed

_lastData.description: Object with cache of last data, pre-parsed, from datasource

_lockDragDrop.description: Whether drag-dropping of DiaryItems is allowed

_colToDayMap.description: provieds a map from columns id's to dates (in seconds)

_selector.description: Holds details of a click-and-drag to add new Items

_ds.description: Reference to the datasource passed in

_itemHash.description: Array holding DiaryItem element ids and DiaryItem refs

YAHOO.widget.Diary.description:
The main diary;

This is the main object. It:

  1. gets the data
  2. does the main background display
  3. sets up the DiaryDay objects and calls their render methods
  4. holds delegated event listeners for the DiaryItems

DiaryItem.name: DiaryItem

_displayDTEND.descripiton: Start time as displayed - may be different to DTEND for multi-day items

backClass.description: Adds css class(es) to the background Item container

column.description: Reference to the column (ie day) this item is in

useCssCategories.description:
If true, any CATEGORIES will be added as css classes
to the container element for the item, allowing styling and filtering.
Anything passed to backClass will also be added.  Spaces in categories
will be changed to hyphens.

_displayDTSTART.descripiton: Start time as displayed - may be different to DTSTART for multi-day items

detailClass.description: Adds css class(es) to the text div container Item container

multiDayPosition.description: Where this item falls if it's a multi-day event

useAnimation.description: Whether to use animation after drag drops

CATEGORIES.description:
Comma separated string of categories for this Item.  If
useCssCategories is true these will be added as css classes (with
hyphens replacing spaces.

UID.description: The unique id of the item.  Write once.

Provides access to the parent item.  For single-day events, it's this,
for multi-day events it's the parent, which will give proper dates/times etc
and ids for editing and so on.

Array of categories, set by CATEGORIES method which parses the string
given in the config object.

DiaryItem.description:
DiaryItem class for individual items in the Diary.

Data and display for particular diary item. Extends resize (and includes drag drop). This class shouldn't be used directly; items to be added should be added by the Diary.addItem() method.

DiaryBlock.description:
A block of diary items.
Holds diary items that overlap in time within a single day.  You won't want
to deal with these directly.
